pr_title: Fix some regex, finals and replace isPresent with ifPresent

timeline.message: Fix some regex, finals and replace isPresent with ifPresent

timeline.bodyText:
This will break the regex though, wouldn't it?
Since . must be escaped otherwise it is treated as a wildcard for any character...
timeline.author: TheBusyBiscuit

replies.bodyText:
No. In a character class it is treated as a literal. Only defined groups such as \w, \s, \d and ranges like 0-9, a-z are not.
Here's a repl too see for yourself: https://repl.it/repls/ComposedJoyfulUnderstanding
replies.author: WalshyDev

replies.bodyText: What's with the slash though? Since that is not in a character class. Did you test this with a charging bench?
replies.author: TheBusyBiscuit

replies.bodyText: Forward slashes don't need to be escaped in Java.
replies.author: WalshyDev

replies.bodyText: Everything I learned was a lie :CryingPepe:
replies.author: TheBusyBiscuit

timeline.bodyText: Same here, wouldn't . be treated as a wildcard?
timeline.author: TheBusyBiscuit
